Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of EC-IC Bypass in AICAO Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to surgical or medical treatment groups.

Participants.evidence: Participants from the Carotid Occlusion Surgery Study (COSS) with recurrent hemispheric ischemia (rHEMI+) and without (rHEMI−).

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to surgical or medical treatment groups.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was all stroke and death from randomisation through 30 days and ipsilateral ischemic stroke within 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 195 participants, 100 were rHEMI+ (50 in each group).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences in the primary endpoint were observed between surgical and nonsurgical groups in rHEMI+ (26.3% vs 22.4%, P = .660) and rHEMI− (18.9% vs 19.5%, P = .943).
